Jacob Jedryszek

Software Engineer at Meta (Ex-MSFT). I helped build Azure Portal, Azure Mobile App, Seeing AI, and Facebook Marketplace.

Blog About Search

About

Current

I am helping to grow Facebook Marketplace.

Past

I helped Microsoft to build Azure Cloud.

I helped to ship the new Azure Management Portal – at the time it was the largest Single Page Application in the World written in TypeScript by over 500 developers.

I started and shipped Azure Management Mobile App - mobile companion app that enables you to monitor your Azure resources and take critical actions while on the go. App had better ratings than AWS and gcloud mobile apps on both App Store and Google Play.

I helped to grow Azure Search - managed search-as-a-service cloud solution that gives developers APIs and tools for adding a rich search experience in web and mobile apps powered by AI.

Together with Michal Franc and Pawel Sawicz I co-founded dotNetConfPL - online conference for .NET Developers. Currently maintained by the community!

Before I joined Microsoft, I was working as Web Developer on variety of projects for different customers, such as law firms, real estate agencies, yearbook publishers, universities, and financial companies. I also developed a Model-Driven Development and Verification Approach for Medical Devices, while working for SAnToS Lab at Kansas State University where I got my Master Degree.

In addition to Master Degree I also got two Bachelor degrees: in Computer Science (from Wroclaw University of Technology) and in Economics (from Wroclaw University of Economics).

 

Public speaker

I occasionally speak at conferences around the World. You can find my talks in the speaking section and on my youtube channel.

Cyclist and triathlete

Cycling is my passion. I ride over 3000 miles on my bike every year. From time to time I participate in bike rides such as Flying Wheels, Seattle To Portland,  Chilly Hilly, Ride from Seattle to Vancouver.

I also swim and run, and I participate in a few triathlons every year.

More

I would love if you follow me on Twitter and subscribe to my youtube channel.

You can find my Open Source projects on github.

You can check my favorite books.

You can find more details about me in my resume.
